summary: This is an internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing the status of the Epstein investigation and specifically a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to interview Prince Andrew. The emails show FBI personnel in New York seeking updates on the request and noting that the SDNY had planned to speak with the U.S. Attorney's office.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: The Duke of York is the subject of a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request by U.S. prosecutors in New York who wish to speak with him as part of the Epstein investigation.

persons.name: John
persons.context: An FBI employee (likely in New York) forwarded a news article link about prosecutors seeking to interview Prince Andrew and is part of the internal email chain seeking updates.

connections.description: John, as FBI personnel, is discussing the status of the MLAT request to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Epstein investigation.

events.title: FBI internal discussion on Prince Andrew MLAT request
events.description: FBI personnel in New York exchange emails seeking updates on the status of a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to interview Prince Andrew regarding the Epstein case.

events.title: SDNY planned discussion with USAO
events.description: The email mentions that the Southern District of New York (SDNY) had planned to speak with the U.S. Attorney's Office about the investigation approximately a week prior to June 8, 2020.

keyFacts: U.S. prosecutors in New York had made a Mutual Legal Assistance Treaty (MLAT) request to interview Prince Andrew as part of the Epstein investigation.
FBI personnel in New York were actively seeking updates on the status of this MLAT request in June 2020.
The Southern District of New York (SDNY) had planned to discuss the investigation with the U.S. Attorney's Office shortly before June 8, 2020.
